ground_truth_answer: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) aims to minimize risks to humans and the environment while controlling pests effectively. According to Document 2, IPM involves five key steps: 1) identifying the pest correctly, 2) observing pest populations and native predators, 3) determining acceptable pest thresholds, 4) implementing cultural and physical controls like proper plant placement and barriers, and 5) applying biological controls such as beneficial organisms. Document 1 demonstrates IPM's effectiveness through specific examples - like plastic barriers reducing potato weevil damage to <5-7% and attract-and-kill products reducing moth populations by up to 98%, while using minimal or no insecticides and protecting natural enemies.
